intro: Orchis mascula var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered twayblade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a single, showy white flower with a distinctive hooded structure. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is typically found in woodland habitats. It has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which aid in nutrient uptake. The species is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare and protected plant in many regions.
